Sentencas: Doped SrTiO3 is a potential anode for intermediate and high temperature solid oxide fuel cells, but by itself has limited catalytic activity for the hydrogen oxidation reaction.
Titulo: B-Site doping and catalytic activity of Sr(Y)TiO3

Sentencas: Its catalytic performance is, however, improved by Ni infiltration.
Titulo: B-Site doping and catalytic activity of Sr(Y)TiO3

Sentencas: The anode polarization is determined over a range of gas compositions of B-site co-doped Sr0.88Y0.08Ti0.95M0.05O3-delta (SYTMO where M represents the B-site dopants) for sparsely Ni-infiltrated SYTMO.
Titulo: B-Site doping and catalytic activity of Sr(Y)TiO3

Sentencas: Co and Cr were selected as the B-site dopants and compared with undoped SYTO based on their differing reducibility.
Titulo: B-Site doping and catalytic activity of Sr(Y)TiO3

Sentencas: All anodes also were subjected to a 12 h reduction/oxidation cycle.
Titulo: B-Site doping and catalytic activity of Sr(Y)TiO3

Sentencas: While Cr-doped anodes showed the best resistance to oxidation, the Co-doped system exhibited the lowest anode polarization resistance under all conditions.
Titulo: B-Site doping and catalytic activity of Sr(Y)TiO3

Sentencas: It was found that H transport is the slowest step for all anodes, which could be partly attributed to sparsity of the infiltrated Ni catalyst.
Titulo: B-Site doping and catalytic activity of Sr(Y)TiO3
